title: Single Select Drop Down
reference-overview: The Single Select Drop Down is a form element that functions like a Radio Button. It allows the user to only select one answer to a question on a form.
reference-usage:
Use the Single Select Drop Down element when form questions have many possible answer choices, like age ranges or state residences. It allows you to conserve space on a page or application because the user has to click on the Single Select Drop Down in order to see the choices. The list retracts once the user makes a selection or clicks out of the Single Select Drop Down element.

Radio Buttons vs. Single Select Drop Down

These two form elements function pretty much the same way. The suggestion is to use Drop Down when the user doesn't need to know all of the alternative choices available (ie. selecting a "State" like Massachusetts. The other options don't matter) or useful for a long list.

Use Radio Buttons when the alternatives matter - when you want the user to see what they are not choosing. Radio buttons allow you to expand the selection and even use longer text.
reference-details:
The "choose one..." (lower case) option in the drop down should be the default selection and listed first. This will distinguish it from a a user selecting an actual value.

When the drop down menu is initially selected the Active State (see below) is highlighted using the "Attention" color.

Margins

In order to keep with Mercer consistency, the margins between Elements have been standardized:

  • Use a 10 pixel bottom between the Element and next Field Label.
  • Use a 3 pixel bottom margin between a Label and an Input.

Labels

All field labels should use Title Case. See the Copy/Text Style Guide narrative for more detail.

Active State

The active state for any field should be indicated by the application of the "Attention" color to the border of the specific field the user has clicked into. See Color Palette for more details on "Attention" color.

Required Fields

All required fields should be denoted by placing the Required icon immediately to the left of the Field Label.

Error Handling

See the Field Specific Error Message page for details.
